{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica cernua |accepted_authority=Howell |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Fl. N.W. Amer., |place=373. 1900 |year=1900 }} |common_names=Serpentine arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica chandleri |authority=Rydberg |rank=species }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica cernua |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica cernua]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 368 |treatment_page=page 374 }}Plants 10–30 cm. Stems (often reddish purple) mostly simple. Leaves 3–4 pairs, mostly cauline (basal often persistent on sterile rosettes); petiolate (petioles usually narrow, proximalmost sometimes broadly winged); blades (often reddish purple) usually elliptic to ovate, sometimes subcordate, 1.5–8 × 1.5–4 cm (often relatively thick, nearly succulent), margins usually entire or serrate, sometimes crenate or slightly lobed, apices acute to rounded, faces glabrous or scabrous. Heads usually 1, sometimes 2–3 (often nodding in bud). Involucres campanulate-turbinate. Phyllaries 8–14, ovate to broadly lanceolate. Ray florets 5–10; corollas yellow to slightly orange. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae dark gray, 6–8 mm, sparsely to densely hirsute (hairs duplex); pappi white, bristles usually barbellate, sometimes subplumose. 2n = 38.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Apr–Jun. |habitat=Serpentine soils, conifer forests |elevation=500–1500 m |distribution=Calif.;Oreg. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica cernua |authority=Howell |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica chandleri |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Apr–Jun. |habitat=Serpentine soils, conifer forests |elevation=500–1500 m |distribution=Calif.;Oreg. |reference=None |publication title=Fl. N.W. Amer., |publication year=1900 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_939.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica cernua }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica chamissonis |accepted_authority=Lessing |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Linnaea |place=6: 238. 1831 |year=1831 }} |common_names=Chamisso arnica;leafy arnica;arnica de Chamisso |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica bernardina |authority=Greene |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica chamissonis var. bernardina |authority=(Greene) Jepson ex Maguire |rank=variety }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica chamissonis subsp. foliosa |authority=(Nuttall) Maguire |rank=subspecies }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica chamissonis var. foliosa |authority=(Nuttall) Maguire |rank=variety }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica chamissonis subsp. incana |authority=(A. Gray) Maguire |rank=subspecies }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica chamissonis var. incana |authority=(A. Gray) Hultén |rank=variety }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica chamissonis var. interior |authority=Maguire |rank=variety }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica chamissonis var. jepsoniana |authority=Maguire |rank=variety }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica foliosa |authority= |rank=species }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica chamissonis |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica chamissonis]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 368 |treatment_page=page 372 }}Plants 20–80(–150) cm. Stems usually branched from mid heights or distally. Leaves 4–10 pairs, mostly cauline (evenly distributed; basal leaves often withered by flowering, 1–2 pairs, subsessile to short-petiolate); sessile (proximalmost with membranous connate-sheathing bases); blades lance-elliptic, broadly oblanceolate, or oblong, 5–20 × 2–6(–8) cm, margins entire or remotely denticulate to prominently dentate, apices acute, faces nearly glabrous or puberulent to sparsely or densely white-tomentose-pilose. Heads (1–)3–10(–16). Involucres campanulate (rarely hemispheric). Phyllaries 8–23, nearly linear to narrowly lanceolate (apices each with conspicuous tuft of white hairs). Ray florets 8–20; corollas yellow. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae gray to brown, 3–8 mm, subglabrous to sparsely hirsutulous, stipitate-glandular; pappi stramineous, bristles barbellate to subplumose. 2n = 38, 57, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Apr–Sep. |habitat=Moist meadows and conifer forests, stream banks, late snow-melt areas, often montane to subalpine |elevation=0–3500 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Man.;N.W.T.;Ont.;Que.;Sask.;Yukon;Alaska;Ariz.;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;N.Mex.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica chamissonis |authority=Lessing |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica bernardina;Arnica chamissonis var. bernardina;Arnica chamissonis subsp. foliosa;Arnica chamissonis var. foliosa;Arnica chamissonis subsp. incana;Arnica chamissonis var. incana;Arnica chamissonis var. interior;Arnica chamissonis var. jepsoniana;Arnica foliosa |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Apr–Sep. |habitat=Moist meadows and conifer forests, stream banks, late snow-melt areas, often montane to subalpine |elevation=0–3500 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Man.;N.W.T.;Ont.;Que.;Sask.;Yukon;Alaska;Ariz.;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;N.Mex.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Linnaea |publication year=1831 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_930.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica chamissonis }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica cordifolia |accepted_authority=Hooker |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Fl. Bor.-Amer. |place=1: 331. 1834 |year=1834 }} |common_names=Heartleaf arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=F |label=Illustrated }}{{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica cordifolia var. pumila |authority=(Rydberg) Maguire |rank=variety }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica paniculata |authority=Fernald |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica whitneyi |authority= |rank=species }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica cordifolia |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica cordifolia]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 368 |treatment_page=page 374 }}Plants 10–40(–70) cm. Stems usually simple, sometimes branched. Leaves 2–4(–6) pairs, mostly cauline (basal often persistent on sterile rosettes); petiolate; blades cordate or subcordate to ovate, 3–10 × 2–10 cm, margins dentate to coarsely dentate, apices acute to rounded, faces puberulent to sparsely villous, sometimes stipitate-glandular (especially adaxial). Heads 1, or 3–5(–10). Involucres broadly campanulate. Phyllaries 10–20, narrowly ovate to lanceolate. Ray florets 6–13; corollas yellow. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae dark gray, 5–10 mm, sparsely to densely hirsute (hairs duplex), sometimes stipitate-glandular as well; pappi white, bristles barbellate. 2n = 38, 57, 76, 95, 114.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering May–Jul. |habitat=Conifer forests to subalpine meadows |elevation=500–3000 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Man.;N.W.T.;Ont.;Sask.;Yukon;Ariz.;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mich.;Mont.;Nev.;N.Mex.;Oreg.;S.Dak.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica cordifolia |authority=Hooker |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica cordifolia var. pumila;Arnica paniculata;Arnica whitneyi |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering May–Jul. |habitat=Conifer forests to subalpine meadows |elevation=500–3000 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Man.;N.W.T.;Ont.;Sask.;Yukon;Ariz.;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mich.;Mont.;Nev.;N.Mex.;Oreg.;S.Dak.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Fl. Bor.-Amer. |publication year=1834 |special status=Illustrated;Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_938.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica cordifolia }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica dealbata |accepted_authority=(A. Gray) B. G. Baldwin |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Novon |place=9: 460. 1999 |year=1999 }} |common_names=Mock leopardbane |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms={{Treatment/ID/Basionym |name=Whitneya dealbata |authority=A. Gray |rank=species |publication_title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |publication_place=6: 550. 1865 }} |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica dealbata |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica dealbata]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 364, 366, 367 |treatment_page=page 375 }}Plants 15–35 cm. Stems mostly simple. Leaves 3–8 pairs, mostly crowded toward bases; petiolate (at least proximal); blades elliptic to oblanceolate or obovate, 5–10 × 0.5–3.5 cm, margins entire, apices acute, faces densely hairy (hairs relatively short, curly) and sessile-glandular (distal leaves sessile, much reduced). Heads 1–6. Involucres campanulate to hemispheric. Phyllaries 5–12 (in 1 series), oblong or elliptic. Ray florets 5–12; corollas yellow. Disc florets (functionally staminate): corollas yellow; anthers yellow (styles rarely exserted). Cypselae brown to black, 4–10 mm, sparsely to densely hirsute (hairs usually simple, rarely duplex) and sparsely stipitate-glandular; pappi 0. 2n = 38, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jun–Aug. |habitat=Open forests, meadows, slopes |elevation=1200–2400 m |distribution=Calif. |discussion=

Although Arnica dealbata lacks pappi, morphologic, cytologic, and molecular data (B. G. Baldwin and B. L. Wessa 2000; Baldwin et al. 2002) clearly support its inclusion in Arnica.

|tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica dealbata |authority=(A. Gray) B. G. Baldwin |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms=Whitneya dealbata |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jun–Aug. |habitat=Open forests, meadows, slopes |elevation=1200–2400 m |distribution=Calif. |reference=None |publication title=Novon |publication year=1999 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_941.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica dealbata }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica discoidea |accepted_authority=Bentham |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Pl. Hartw., |place=319. 1849 |year=1849 }} |common_names=Rayless arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica alata |authority=Rydberg |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica cordifolia var. eradiata |authority=A. Gray |rank=variety }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica discoidea var. alata |authority=(Rydberg) Cronquist |rank=variety }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica discoidea var. eradiata |authority=(A. Gray) Cronquist |rank=variety }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica parviflora |authority= |rank=species }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica discoidea |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica discoidea]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 367 |treatment_page=page 375 }}Plants 15–60 cm. Stems mostly simple or distally branched. Leaves 3–7 pairs, sometimes crowded at stem bases (basal leaves often persistent on sterile rosettes); petiolate (petioles narrow, 1.5–8 cm, often broadly winged on distal reduced leaves); blades usually ovate to broadly lanceolate, seldom subcordate, 2–12 × 1–7 cm, margins usually serrate to coarsely dentate or crenate, rarely subentire, faces glabrate to pilose, stipitate-glandular. Heads 3–10(–30; erect). Involucres turbinate-campanulate. Phyllaries 8–15, ovate-lanceolate to narrowly lanceolate. Ray florets usually 0 (corollas of peripheral florets rarely dilated, resembling rays). Disc florets 20–50; corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae dark gray, 6–8 mm, hirsute (hairs duplex) and stipitate-glandular; pappi white, bristles usually barbellate, sometimes subplumose. 2n = 38, 57, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering May–Jul. |habitat=Chaparral, oak and pine forests |elevation=100–1500 m |distribution=Calif.;Nev.;Oreg.;Wash. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica discoidea |authority=Bentham |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica alata;Arnica cordifolia var. eradiata;Arnica discoidea var. alata;Arnica discoidea var. eradiata;Arnica parviflora |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering May–Jul. |habitat=Chaparral, oak and pine forests |elevation=100–1500 m |distribution=Calif.;Nev.;Oreg.;Wash. |reference=None |publication title=Pl. Hartw., |publication year=1849 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_942.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica discoidea }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica fulgens |accepted_authority=Pursh |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Fl. Amer. Sept. |place=2: 527. 1813 |year=1813 }} |common_names=Foothill arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica monocephala |authority=Rydberg |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica pedunculata |authority=Rydberg |rank=species }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica fulgens |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica fulgens]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 367 |treatment_page=page 370 }}Plants 10–75 cm. Stems solitary, simple. Leaves 3–5 pairs, crowded toward stem bases (some or all axils with dense tufts of brown wool); petiolate (petioles at least basal leaves, narrow or broadly winged); blades (with 3 or 5 prominent, subparallel veins) usually narrowly oblanceolate to oblong, rarely oval or broadly spatulate, 4.5–20 × 0.5–2.5 cm, margins denticulate, apices obtuse, faces moderately uniformly hairy, stipitate-glandular. Heads 1(–3). Involucres broadly hemispheric. Phyllaries 13–21, elliptic-oblong or narrowly to broadly lanceolate. Ray florets 8–16; corollas yellow-orange. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae brown, 3.5–7 mm, densely hirsute, sometimes sparingly stipitate-glandular; pappi usually white, sometimes tawny, bristles barbellate. 2n = 38, 57.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering May–Jul. |habitat=Prairies and grasslands to montane conifer forests |elevation=500–3000 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Man.;Sask.;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;N.Dak.;Oreg.;S.Dak.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica fulgens |authority=Pursh |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica monocephala;Arnica pedunculata |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering May–Jul. |habitat=Prairies and grasslands to montane conifer forests |elevation=500–3000 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Man.;Sask.;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;N.Dak.;Oreg.;S.Dak.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Fl. Amer. Sept. |publication year=1813 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_923.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica fulgens }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica gracilis |accepted_authority=Rydberg |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Bull. Torrey Bot. Club |place=24: 297. 1897 |year=1897 }} |common_names=Smallhead arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica latifolia var. gracilis |authority=(Rydberg) Cronquist |rank=variety }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica gracilis |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica gracilis]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 368 |treatment_page=page 376 }}Plants 10–30 cm. Stems (often 5–10 in dense clumps) branched distally. Leaves 2–3 pairs, mostly cauline (basal leaves often persistent on sterile rosettes, similar to cauline leaves); petiolate (petioles narrowly to broadly winged, distal pair of leaves often reduced, connate-perfoliate); blades ovate to ovate-lanceolate, 2–6 × 1–3 cm, margins irregularly serrate to subentire, apices acute, faces: abaxial glandular, adaxial stipitate-glandular. Heads (1–)5–15. Involucres turbinate-campanulate. Phyllaries 10–16, ovate-lanceolate. Ray florets 5–12; corollas yellow. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae black, 4.5–7 mm, hairy (hairs duplex) and stipitate-glandular; pappi white, bristles barbellate. 2n = 57, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Aug. |habitat=Dry, exposed, rocky, alpine slopes, sometimes subalpine meadows |elevation=1200–2500 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Idaho;Mont.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica gracilis |authority=Rydberg |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica latifolia var. gracilis |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jul–Aug. |habitat=Dry, exposed, rocky, alpine slopes, sometimes subalpine meadows |elevation=1200–2500 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Idaho;Mont.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Bull. Torrey Bot. Club |publication year=1897 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_946.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica gracilis }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica griscomii |accepted_authority=Fernald |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Rhodora |place=26: 105, plate 143, fig. 7. 1924 |year=1924 }} |common_names=Snow arnica |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica louiseana subsp. griscomii |authority=(Fernald) Maguire |rank=subspecies }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica griscomii |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica griscomii]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 368 |treatment_page=page 371 }}Plants 5–40 cm. Stems usually simple, rarely branched. Leaves 1–4 pairs, mostly cauline; petiolate; blades elliptic, lanceolate, oblanceolate, ovate, or spatulate, 1.2–10 × 0.5–3.5 cm, margins usually denticulate to dentate, rarely entire, apices acute to obtuse or abruptly pointed, faces usually glabrous or sparingly hispidulous-puberulent, rarely stipitate-glandular. Heads usually 1, sometimes 2–3 (erect or nodding). Involucres hemispheric to campanulate-turbinate (bases sparsely to densely pilose, hairs white or yellow). Phyllaries 9–20, lanceolate to oblanceolate, not stipitate-glandular. Ray florets 6–17; corollas yellow. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae brown, 2.5–6 mm, abaxially glabrous, adaxially sparsely hirsute or glabrous throughout, rarely glandular; pappi white, bristles barbellate.{{Treatment/Body |distribution=B.C.;N.W.T.;Nfld. and Labr. (Nfld.);Que.;Yukon;Alaska;Asia (e Russia). |discussion=

Subspecies 2 (2 in the flora).

|tables= |references= }}

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica lanceolata |accepted_authority=Nuttall |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Trans. Amer. Philos. Soc., n. s. |place=7: 407. 1841 |year=1841 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica lanceolata |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica lanceolata]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 368 |treatment_page=page 373 }}Plants (5–)20–80 cm. Stems solitary to densely clumped, simple or branched among heads. Leaves 4–8(–10) pairs, mostly cauline; usually sessile (sometimes with partly connate-sheathing bases), sometimes petiolate (proximalmost); blades lance-elliptic, lanceolate, oblanceolate, obovate, or ovate, 4–12(–20) × (1–)2–6(–8) cm, margins subentire to dentate-serrate, apices usually acute, rarely obtuse, faces glabrate to pilose. Heads (1–)3–10(–20). Involucres narrowly campanulate to turbinate. Phyllaries 8–15(–19), narrowly to broadly lanceolate. Ray florets (5–)7–17(–20); corollas yellow. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae brown, 4–8 mm, sparsely hirsutulous, stipitate-glandular; pappi tawny, bristles subplumose.{{Treatment/Body |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;N.B.;N.W.T.;Que.;Yukon;Alaska;Calif.;Idaho;Maine;Mont.;N.H.;Nev.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |discussion=

Subspecies 2 (2 in the flora).

|tables= |references= }}
==Key==
{| class="wikitable fna-keytable" |-id=key-0-1 |1 |Cauline leaves mostly sessile (proximalmost pair petiolate); e North America |[[Arnica lanceolata subsp. lanceolata|Arnica lanceolata subsp. lanceolata]] |-id=key-0-1 |1 |Cauline leaves sessile (including proximalmost pair, bases sometimes partly connate-sheathing); w North America |[[Arnica lanceolata subsp. prima|Arnica lanceolata subsp. prima]] |}

species[[Arnica lanceolata]]
subspecies[[Arnica lanceolata subsp. lanceolata]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page= |treatment_page=page 373 }}Leaves: basal petiolate, blades elliptic-lanceolate or oblanceolate, margins subentire, denticulate, or dentate-serrate; cauline mostly sessile (proximalmost pair petiolate), blades lanceolate to elliptic-lanceolate or oblanceolate, margins subentire, irregularly denticulate, or serrate, faces glabrate to scantily pilose. Phyllaries narrowly to broadly lanceolate. 2n = 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jun–Sep. |habitat=Moist areas, stream banks, gravel bars, to subalpine meadows |elevation=0–1000 m |distribution=N.B.;Que.;Maine;N.H. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica lanceolata subsp. lanceolata |authority= |rank=subspecies |parent rank=species |synonyms=Arnica mollis var. petiolaris |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jun–Sep. |habitat=Moist areas, stream banks, gravel bars, to subalpine meadows |elevation=0–1000 m |distribution=N.B.;Que.;Maine;N.H. |reference=None |publication title= |publication year= |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_935.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica lanceolata |subspecies=Arnica lanceolata subsp. lanceolata }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica lanceolata]]

family[[Asteraceae]]

genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica lanceolata]]
subspecies[[Arnica lanceolata subsp. prima]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page= |treatment_page=page 373 }}Leaves: basal commonly withered by flowering, sessile or subsessile to petiolate, blades usually oblong to narrowly lanceolate or oblanceolate, rarely ovate, margins subentire to prominently dentate-serrate; cauline sessile (bases sometimes partly connate-sheathing), blades narrowly to broadly lance-elliptic or ovate, margins subentire to serrate-dentate, faces sparsely to densely pilose. Phyllaries narrowly lanceolate. 2n = 38, 57, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering May–Sep. |habitat=Moist areas, along stream banks, snow-melt areas, montane to alpine meadows |elevation=0–3000 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;N.W.T.;Yukon;Alaska;Calif.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |discussion=

The name Arnica amplexifolia Rydberg (1900c) was a superfluous (illegitimate) substitution for A. amplexicaulis Nuttall (1841).

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica latifolia |accepted_authority=Bongard |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Mém. Acad. Imp. Sci. St.-Pétersbourg, Sér. |place=6, Sci. Math. 2: 147. 1832 |year=1832 }} |common_names=Broadleaf arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=F |label=Illustrated }}{{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica latifolia |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica latifolia]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 367 |treatment_page=page 376 }}Plants 10–50 cm. Stems usually simple, sometimes branched distally. Leaves 2–4(–6) pairs, cauline (basal leaves often persistent on sterile rosettes), petiolate (proximal, petioles relatively short, broadly winged) or sessile (mid and distal); blades lance-elliptic to ovate, 2–10 × 1–6 cm, margins serrate to dentate, apices obtuse to acute, faces glabrous or sparsely villous. Heads 1 or 3–5(–9). Involucres narrowly turbinate. Phyllaries 8–20, lanceolate to oblanceolate. Ray florets 8–15; corollas yellow. Disc florets 20–90; corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae dark brown, 5–9 mm, sparsely villous; pappi white, bristles barbellate. 2n = 38, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Aug. |habitat=Relatively moist, montane conifer forests to subalpine meadows |elevation=500–3300 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;N.W.T.;Yukon;Alaska;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica latifolia |authority=Bongard |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jul–Aug. |habitat=Relatively moist, montane conifer forests to subalpine meadows |elevation=500–3300 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;N.W.T.;Yukon;Alaska;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Mém. Acad. Imp. Sci. St.-Pétersbourg, Sér. |publication year=1832 |special status=Illustrated;Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_945.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica latifolia }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica lessingii |accepted_authority=(Torrey & A. Gray) Greene |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Pittonia |place=4: 167. 1900 |year=1900 }} |common_names=Nodding arnica |basionyms={{Treatment/ID/Basionym |name=Arnica angustifolia var. lessingii |authority=Torrey & A. Gray |rank=variety |publication_title=Fl. N. Amer. |publication_place=2: 449. 1843 }} |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica lessingii subsp. norbergii |authority=Hultén & Maguire |rank=subspecies }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica lessingii |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica lessingii]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 366, 367 |treatment_page=page 369 }}Plants 8–35 cm. Stems (1–3 together) usually simple, rarely branched (moderately to densely hairy, hairs translucent with purple septa). Leaves (2–)3–5(–6) pairs, usually crowded toward stem bases; petiolate or sessile (petioles short-winged); blades elliptic, lanceolate, or broadly oblanceolate, 3–10 × 1–2.5 cm, margins usually entire proximal to mid blade, subentire to denticulate distally, apices acute to obtuse, faces: abaxial paler and often glabrous, adaxial slightly hairy. Heads 1 (nodding). Involucres turbinate-campanulate (bases moderately villous, hairs brownish). Phyllaries 11–15, lanceolate to elliptic (apices obtuse, tips blunt, callous). Ray florets 8–13; corollas yellow (laminae 14–20 mm). Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers dark purple. Cypselae brown, 5–6 mm, sparsely strigose (hairs simple, apically pointed) or glabrous; pappi tawny, bristles barbellate. 2n = 38, 57, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jun–Sep. |habitat=Coastal tundra to alpine slopes |elevation=0–1500 m |distribution=B.C.;N.W.T.;Yukon;Alaska;Asia (Russian Far East). |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica lessingii |authority=(Torrey & A. Gray) Greene |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica lessingii subsp. norbergii |basionyms=Arnica angustifolia var. lessingii |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jun–Sep. |habitat=Coastal tundra to alpine slopes |elevation=0–1500 m |distribution=B.C.;N.W.T.;Yukon;Alaska;Asia (Russian Far East). |reference=None |publication title=Pittonia |publication year=1900 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_917.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica lessingii }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica lonchophylla |accepted_authority=Greene |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Pittonia |place=4: 164. 1900 |year=1900 }} |common_names=Longleaf arnica;northern arnica;arnica lonchophylle |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica alpina subsp. lonchophylla |authority=(Greene) G. W. Douglas & Ruyle-Douglas |rank=subspecies }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica angustifolia subsp. lonchophylla |authority=(Greene) G. W. Douglas & Ruyle-Douglas |rank=subspecies }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica arnoglossa |authority=Greene |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica chionopappa |authority=Fernald |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica gaspensis |authority=Fernald |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica lonchophylla subsp. arnoglossa |authority=(Greene) Maguire |rank=subspecies }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica lonchophylla subsp. chionopappa |authority=(Fernald) Maguire |rank=subspecies }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica lonchophylla |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica lonchophylla]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 368 |treatment_page=page 370 }}Plants 12–50 cm. Stems usually simple, rarely branched. Leaves 3–7 pairs, mostly cauline; petiolate (petioles, at least proximal, relatively narrow, ± equaling blades); blades narrowly to broadly lanceolate or ovate, 3.5–14 × 0.5–3.7 cm, margins regularly dentate or denticulate, apices acute, faces glabrous or moderately pilose, sparsely to densely stipitate-glandular. Heads 3–8 (erect). Involucres campanulate-turbinate. Phyllaries 6–14, lanceolate (apices acute). Ray florets 6–17; corollas yellow. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae gray to brown, 3–6 mm, densely hirsute, sometimes stipitate-glandular; pappi white, bristles barbellate. 2n = 38, 57, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering June–Aug. |habitat=Dry to mesic, open montane slopes, open woodlands, stream gravels, shorelines, calcareous rocky outcrops, to lowland Arctic tundra |elevation=0–1500 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Man.;N.B.;Nfld. and Labr. (Nfld.);N.W.T.;N.S.;Nunavut;Ont.;Que.;Sask.;Yukon;Alaska;S.Dak.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica lonchophylla |authority=Greene |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica alpina subsp. lonchophylla;Arnica angustifolia subsp. lonchophylla;Arnica arnoglossa;Arnica chionopappa;Arnica gaspensis;Arnica lonchophylla subsp. arnoglossa;Arnica lonchophylla subsp. chionopappa |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering June–Aug. |habitat=Dry to mesic, open montane slopes, open woodlands, stream gravels, shorelines, calcareous rocky outcrops, to lowland Arctic tundra |elevation=0–1500 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Man.;N.B.;Nfld. and Labr. (Nfld.);N.W.T.;N.S.;Nunavut;Ont.;Que.;Sask.;Yukon;Alaska;S.Dak.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Pittonia |publication year=1900 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_922.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica lonchophylla }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica longifolia |accepted_authority=D. C. Eaton |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=in S. Watson, Botany (Fortieth Parallel), |place=186. 1871 |year=1871 }} |common_names=Spearleaf arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica longifolia subsp. myriadenia |authority=(Piper) Maguire |rank=subspecies }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica myriadenia |authority= |rank=species }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica longifolia |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica longifolia]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 368 |treatment_page=page 374 }}Plants 30–60(–110) cm. Stems (often relatively numerous, clustered in clonal patches) simple. Leaves 5–7 pairs, mostly cauline (basal leaves usually withered by flowering); sessile or subsessile (proximalmost with connate-sheathing bases); blades lanceolate to lance-elliptic, 5–12(–15) × 1.5–3.5 cm, margins usually entire, rarely denticulate, apices acute to acuminate, faces scabrid-puberulent, sometimes glandular (distal leaves not much reduced). Heads 3–20(–35). Involucres turbinate-campanulate. Phyllaries 11–15(–20), narrow to broadly lanceolate. Ray florets 6–15; corollas yellow. Disc florets 6–11; corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae brown to black, 3–7 mm, glabrous or sparsely hirsutulous, stipitate-glandular; pappi stramineous to tawny, bristles barbellate to subplumose. 2n = 57, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jun–Oct. |habitat=Montane coniferous forests to alpine, usually moist areas, stream banks or late snow-melt areas |elevation=1300–3700 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica longifolia |authority=D. C. Eaton |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica longifolia subsp. myriadenia;Arnica myriadenia |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jun–Oct. |habitat=Montane coniferous forests to alpine, usually moist areas, stream banks or late snow-melt areas |elevation=1300–3700 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=in S. Watson, Botany (Fortieth Parallel), |publication year=1871 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_937.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica longifolia }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica louiseana |accepted_authority=Farr |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Ottawa Naturalist |place=20: 109. 1906 |year=1906 }} |common_names=Lake Louise arnica;snow arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica louiseana |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica louiseana]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 368 |treatment_page=page 371 }}Plants 5–20 cm. Stems simple. Leaves 1–3 pairs, mostly cauline (shorter plants often with leaves crowed mostly toward bases); petiolate; blades elliptic, oblong, or ovate-lanceolate, 1.5–7.5 × 0.5–2 cm, margins usually entire, rarely denticulate or slightly undulate, apices usually obtuse, sometimes acute or acuminate, faces glabrous or hispidulous-puberulent, ± densely stipitate-glandular. Heads usually 1, sometimes 2–3 (nodding at flowering). Involucres campanulate-turbinate. Phyllaries 10–20, narrowly lanceolate (stipitate-glandular). Ray florets 7–10; corollas yellow. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae brown, 3–5 mm, abaxially glabrous, adaxially sparsely hirsute or glabrous throughout, usually stipitate-glandular toward apices, sometimes densely stipitate-glandular throughout; pappi white, bristles barbellate. 2n = 76, 95.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Aug. |habitat=Exposed tundra slopes and calcareous rock slides |elevation=1800–2100 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica louiseana |authority=Farr |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jul–Aug. |habitat=Exposed tundra slopes and calcareous rock slides |elevation=1800–2100 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C. |reference=None |publication title=Ottawa Naturalist |publication year=1906 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_928.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica louiseana }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica mollis |accepted_authority=Hooker |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Fl. Bor.-Amer. |place=1: 331. 1834 |year=1834 }} |common_names=Hairy arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=F |label=Illustrated }}{{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica mollis |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica mollis]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 367 |treatment_page=page 372 }}Plants 15–70 cm. Stems (forming clumps) simple or branched among heads. Leaves (2–)3(–4) pairs, mostly cauline (basal sometimes present); petiolate (petioles relatively short, broad-winged) or subsessile; blades broadly elliptic, lance-elliptic, or narrowly to broadly lanceolate, 4–20 × 1–4 cm, margins entire or irregularly denticulate, apices acute, faces sparsely to moderately hairy (hairs relatively short to long, stipitate glands or soft, silky). Heads 1 or 3–7. Involucres hemispheric to campanulate. Phyllaries 10–22, usually broadly lanceolate, rarely narrowly lanceolate or oblanceolate. Ray florets 10–22; corollas yellow. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae grayish brown to black, 4–8 mm, mostly stipitate-glandular, sparsely hirsutulous (hairs white to brownish, simple or bifid); pappi tawny, bristles plumose (with deep, amberlike deposits). 2n = 38, 57, 76, 95, 114, 133, 152.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jun–Sep. |habitat=Moist meadows and conifer forests, stream banks, late snow-melt areas, montane to subalpine |elevation=1000–4000 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;N.W.T.;Yukon;Alaska;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica mollis |authority=Hooker |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jun–Sep. |habitat=Moist meadows and conifer forests, stream banks, late snow-melt areas, montane to subalpine |elevation=1000–4000 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;N.W.T.;Yukon;Alaska;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Fl. Bor.-Amer. |publication year=1834 |special status=Illustrated;Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_931.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica mollis }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica nevadensis |accepted_authority=A. Gray |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |place=19: 55. 1883 |year=1883 }} |common_names=Nevada arnica;Sierra arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica tomentella |authority=Greene |rank=species }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica nevadensis |hierarchy_nav=

tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica nevadensis]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 368 |treatment_page=page 374 }}Plants 10–50 cm. Stems simple. Leaves 2–3 pairs, mostly cauline (basal leaves often persistent on sterile rosettes); petiolate (petioles narrowly to broadly winged); blades elliptic to ovate, 3–8 × 2–4 cm, margins entire or denticulate, apices acute to rounded, faces stipitate-glandular. Heads 1(–3). Involucres campanulate-turbinate. Phyllaries 10–16, oblanceolate. Ray florets 6–14; corollas yellow. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae dark gray, 6–9 mm, stipitate-glandular; pappi white or tawny, bristles barbellate to subplumose. 2n = 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Aug. |habitat=Coniferous forests, meadows, rocky slopes |elevation=1500–3000 m |distribution=Calif.;Nev.;Oreg.;Wash. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica nevadensis |authority=A. Gray |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica tomentella |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jul–Aug. |habitat=Coniferous forests, meadows, rocky slopes |elevation=1500–3000 m |distribution=Calif.;Nev.;Oreg.;Wash. |reference=None |publication title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |publication year=1883 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_940.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica nevadensis }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica ovata |accepted_authority=Greene |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Pittonia |place=4: 161. 1900 |year=1900 }} |common_names=Sticky leaf arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica diversifolia |authority=Greene |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica latifolia var. viscidula |authority=A. Gray |rank=variety }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica ovata |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica ovata]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 368 |treatment_page=page 372 }}Plants 10–50 cm. Stems (forming clumps) simple or branched among heads. Leaves 2–3(–4) pairs (basal 1–2 pairs usually withered by flowering, petiolate, petioles broadly winged, blades round-ovate, relatively small; sterile rosettes lacking), mostly cauline; petiolate (at least middle pair, petioles broadly to narrowly winged); blades broadly deltate to ovate, 4–8 × 2–6 cm (middle pair largest), margins irregularly denticulate to coarsely dentate-serrate, apices acute, faces puberulent (hairs minute) and stipitate-glandular. Heads 1–3(–5). Involucres usually narrowly turbinate, rarely narrowly campanulate. Phyllaries 9–20, linear to narrowly lanceolate. Ray florets 8–16, yellow. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae brown to black, 5–7 mm, sparsely to moderately pilose and stipitate-glandular; pappi stramineous to tawny, bristles subplumose. 2n = 57, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Sep. |habitat=Moist meadows and conifer forests, stream banks, late snow-melt areas, montane to subalpine |elevation=200–3600 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Yukon;Alaska;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica ovata |authority=Greene |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica diversifolia;Arnica latifolia var. viscidula |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jul–Sep. |habitat=Moist meadows and conifer forests, stream banks, late snow-melt areas, montane to subalpine |elevation=200–3600 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Yukon;Alaska;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Pittonia |publication year=1900 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_932.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica ovata }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica parryi |accepted_authority=A. Gray |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Amer. Naturalist |place=8: 213. 1874 |year=1874 }} |common_names=Parry’s arnica;nodding arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=F |label=Illustrated }}{{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms={{Treatment/ID/Basionym |name=Arnica angustifolia subsp. eradiata |authority=A. Gray |rank=subspecies |publication_title=Proc. Acad. Nat. Sci. Philadelphia |publication_place=15: 68. 1864 }} |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica parryi subsp. sonnei |authority=(Greene) Maguire |rank=subspecies }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica parryi var. sonnei |authority=(Greene) Cronquist |rank=variety }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica parryi |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica parryi]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 367 |treatment_page=page 373 }}Plants 15–50(–60) cm. Stems simple or branched among heads. Leaves (2–)3–4 pairs, basal and cauline (basal usually withered by flowering, petiolate or subsessile, blades ovate or nearly round to oblong-ovate, much smaller than cauline; sterile rosettes often present, proximal cauline often crowded toward stems bases); petiolate; blades broadly to narrowly lanceolate, oblong-ovate, ovate-lanceolate, or round, 4–22 × 1–6 cm, (bases obtuse or cuneate to truncate) margins usually entire, sometimes sparsely denticulate, faces scantily to moderately pilose (hairs white), adaxial sparsely stipitate-glandular (distal cauline leaves sessile, extremely reduced, nearly linear to narrowly elliptic-lanceolate). Heads (1–)3–9(–14; often nodding in bud). Involucres turbinate to narrowly campanulate. Phyllaries 8–20, linear to narrowly lanceolate. Ray florets usually 0 (sometimes peripheral florets pistillate; corollas yellow, laminae rudimentary). Disc florets 20–50; corollas yellow (1 or more lobes sometimes expanded, giving appearance of laminae); anthers yellow. Cypselae brown to black, 4–7 mm, glabrous or sparsely stipitate-glandular to densely hirsute; pappi usually stramineous, rarely tawny, bristles barbellate to ± subplumose. 2n = 38, 57, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering May–Sep. |habitat=Open conifer forests to alpine meadows |elevation=500–3800 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Yukon;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica parryi |authority=A. Gray |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica parryi subsp. sonnei;Arnica parryi var. sonnei |basionyms=Arnica angustifolia subsp. eradiata |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering May–Sep. |habitat=Open conifer forests to alpine meadows |elevation=500–3800 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Yukon;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Amer. Naturalist |publication year=1874 |special status=Illustrated;Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_933.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica parryi }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica rydbergii |accepted_authority=Greene |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Pittonia |place=4: 36. 1899 |year=1899 }} |common_names=Rydberg’s arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica rydbergii |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica rydbergii]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 367 |treatment_page=page 371 }}Plants 8–35 cm. Stems (branches from rhizomes) simple. Leaves 2–4 pairs (basal often persistent on sterile rosettes), mostly cauline; petiolate (at least basal) or sessile; blades oblanceolate to spatulate, 2–7 × 0.5–2.5 cm, margins usually entire, sometimes denticulate, rarely dentate, apices usually acute, sometimes obtuse, faces sparsely puberulent, moderately pubescent distally, stipitate-glandular. Heads 1–3(–5). Involucres turbinate-campanulate. Phyllaries 9–15, linear-oblong to narrowly lanceolate. Ray florets 6–10; corollas yellow. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae brown, 4–7 mm, densely hirsute (not stipitate-glandular); pappi white, bristles barbellate. 2n = 38, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Aug. |habitat=Dry to mesic, exposed, rocky alpine slopes and ridges or alpine meadows |elevation=1200–3400 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica rydbergii |authority=Greene |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jul–Aug. |habitat=Dry to mesic, exposed, rocky alpine slopes and ridges or alpine meadows |elevation=1200–3400 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Colo.;Idaho;Mont.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Pittonia |publication year=1899 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_929.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica rydbergii }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica sororia |accepted_authority=Greene |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Ottawa Naturalist |place=23: 213. 1910 |year=1910 }} |common_names=Twin arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica fulgens var. sororia |authority=(Greene) G. W. Douglas & Ruyle-Douglas |rank=variety }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica sororia |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica sororia]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 367 |treatment_page=page 370 }}Plants 15–50 cm. Stems (1 or relatively few) simple or branched. Leaves 3–6 pairs, crowded toward stem bases (axils lacking tufts of brown wool); petiolate (petioles, at least basal, narrowly winged); blades (with 3 or 5, prominent, subparallel veins) oblanceolate to narrowly oblong, 3.5–14.5 × 0.6–2.4 cm, margins usually entire, rarely denticulate, apices obtuse, faces uniformly hairy, stipitate-glandular. Heads 1–5. Involucres hemispheric. Phyllaries 13–20, usually narrowly, sometimes broadly, lanceolate. Ray florets 9–17; corollas yellow-orange. Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae brown, 3.5–5 mm, densely hirsute, sometimes sparingly glandular as well; pappi white, bristles barbellate. 2n = 38.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering May–Jul. |habitat=Prairies and grasslands to montane conifer forests |elevation=500–1500 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Sask.;Calif.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica sororia |authority=Greene |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica fulgens var. sororia |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering May–Jul. |habitat=Prairies and grasslands to montane conifer forests |elevation=500–1500 m |distribution=Alta.;B.C.;Sask.;Calif.;Idaho;Mont.;Nev.;Oreg.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Ottawa Naturalist |publication year=1910 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_924.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica sororia }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica spathulata |accepted_authority=Greene |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Pittonia |place=3: 103. 1896 |year=1896 }} |common_names=Klamath arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica eastwoodiae |authority=Rydberg |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica spathulata subsp. eastwoodiae |authority=(Rydberg) Maguire |rank=subspecies }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Arnica spathulata var. eastwoodiae |authority=(Rydberg) Ediger & T. M. Barkley |rank=variety }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica spathulata |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica spathulata]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 367 |treatment_page=page 376 }}Plants 15–45+ cm. Stems simple or branched. Leaves 3–5 pairs, sometimes crowded toward bases (basal leaves often persistent on sterile rosettes); petiolate (petioles mostly broadly winged, 1–9 × 0.2–1.5 cm); blades elliptic-ovate to spatulate, 2–8 × 1–4 cm, margins subentire to mostly irregularly dentate, apices acute, faces sparsely to densely villous, stipitate-glandular. Heads 1, or 3–9(–25). Involucres turbinate-campanulate. Phyllaries 8–15, broadly to narrowly lanceolate. Ray florets 0. Disc florets 15–50; corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae black, 5–10 mm, sparsely stipitate-glandular; pappi white, bristles barbellate. 2n = 38, 76.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Apr–Jul. |habitat=Usually serpentine soils, open, dry oak–conifer forests, disturbed areas |elevation=200–1500 m |distribution=Calif.;Oreg. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica spathulata |authority=Greene |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Arnica eastwoodiae;Arnica spathulata subsp. eastwoodiae;Arnica spathulata var. eastwoodiae |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Apr–Jul. |habitat=Usually serpentine soils, open, dry oak–conifer forests, disturbed areas |elevation=200–1500 m |distribution=Calif.;Oreg. |reference=None |publication title=Pittonia |publication year=1896 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_943.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica spathulata }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica unalaschcensis |accepted_authority=Lessing |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Linnaea |place=6: 238. 1831 |year=1831 }} |common_names=Alaska arnica |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica unalaschcensis |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica unalaschcensis]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 366, 367 |treatment_page=page 369 }}Plants 8–30 cm. Stems simple (sparsely to moderately hairy, hairs translucent with purple septa). Leaves 2–5 pairs, mostly cauline; petiolate (proximal) or sessile; blades elliptic-oblanceolate, obovate or spatulate, (3–)5–12 × 1.5–3 cm, margins usually entire proximal to mid blade, serrate to dentate distally, apices acute to obtuse or abruptly pointed, faces usually glabrate, sometimes scabrous to sparsely stipitate-glandular. Heads 1 (erect). Involucres hemispheric or turbinate-hemispheric (bases moderately villous). Phyllaries 14–24, lanceolate (apices obtuse, tips blunt, callous). Ray florets 6–17; corollas yellow (laminae 12–17 mm). Disc florets: corollas yellow; anthers dark purple. Cypselae brown, 4–5 mm, shortly hispidulous (hairs duplex, apically forked) and stipitate-glandular; pappi tawny, bristles subplumose. 2n = 38.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jun–Aug. |habitat=Coastal tundra to alpine slopes |elevation=0–1500 m |distribution=Alaska;Asia (Japan;Russian Far East). |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica unalaschcensis |authority=Lessing |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jun–Aug. |habitat=Coastal tundra to alpine slopes |elevation=0–1500 m |distribution=Alaska;Asia (Japan;Russian Far East). |reference=None |publication title=Linnaea |publication year=1831 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_918.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica unalaschcensis }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica venosa |accepted_authority=H. M. Hall |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Univ. Calif. Publ. Bot. |place=6: 174. 1915 |year=1915 }} |common_names=Shasta County arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica venosa |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica venosa]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 367 |treatment_page=page 376 }}Plants 20–60 cm. Stems simple or branched (prominently ribbed; caudices woody). Leaves 6–10 pairs, cauline (basal leaves withered by flowering; proximal cauline scalelike, middle leaves largest, distal reduced, bractlike) usually broadly sessile, rarely broadly petiolate; blades (3- or 5-nerved, strongly reticulate-veined) ovate-elliptic to broadly lanceolate, 3–7 × 1.5–4 cm (firm), margins irregularly and coarsely serrate, apices acute to obtuse, faces: abaxial pilose, stipitate-glandular (especially on veins), adaxial glabrate to stipitate-glandular. Heads 1. Involucres turbinate-campanulate. Phyllaries 8–19, ovate to broadly lanceolate. Ray florets 0. Disc florets 30–60; corollas yellow; anthers yellow. Cypselae dark gray, 6–8 mm, densely hirsute (hairs duplex); pappi white, bristles barbellate. 2n = 38.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering May–Jun. |habitat=Open, often disturbed, oak-pine forests |elevation=400–1400 m |distribution=Calif. |discussion=

Arnica venosa is known only from Shasta and Trinity counties.

|tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica venosa |authority=H. M. Hall |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering May–Jun. |habitat=Open, often disturbed, oak-pine forests |elevation=400–1400 m |distribution=Calif. |reference=None |publication title=Univ. Calif. Publ. Bot. |publication year=1915 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_944.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica venosa }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnica viscosa |accepted_authority=A. Gray |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |place=13: 374. 1878 |year=1878 }} |common_names=Mt. Shasta arnica |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Chrysopsis shastensis |authority=Jepson |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Raillardella paniculata |authority=Greene |rank=species }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae;Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae;Arnica;Arnica viscosa |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae]]
subtribe[[Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae]]
genus[[Arnica]]
species[[Arnica viscosa]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 367 |treatment_page=page 377 }}Plants 20–50 cm. Stems branched (prominently ribbed, strongly stipitate-glandular; caudices woody). Leaves 5–10 pairs (main stems, 2–6 pairs on branches; basal withered by flowering), cauline; sessile; blades obovate-oblong to ovate-oblong, (1–)2–4(–5) × 1–3 cm, margins ± entire, apices acute, faces sparsely to densely pilose, densely stipitate-glandular. Heads 10–20. Involucres narrowly turbinate. Phyllaries 10–20, broadly lanceolate (stipitate-glandular). Ray florets 0. Disc florets 10–30; corollas cream; anthers yellow. Cypselae dark gray, 4.5–6.5 mm, stipitate-glandular; pappi usually white, rarely tawny, bristles barbellate to subplumose. 2n = 38.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Aug–Sep. |habitat=Open, rocky subalpine to alpine |elevation=1700–2500 m |distribution=Calif.;Oreg. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnica viscosa |authority=A. Gray |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Chrysopsis shastensis;Raillardella paniculata |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Aug–Sep. |habitat=Open, rocky subalpine to alpine |elevation=1700–2500 m |distribution=Calif.;Oreg. |reference=None |publication title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |publication year=1878 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_947.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Heliantheae |subtribe=Asteraceae (tribe Heliantheae) subtribe Chaenactidinae |genus=Arnica |species=Arnica viscosa }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Arnica]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnoglossum |accepted_authority=Rafinesque |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Fl. Ludov., |place=64. 1817 |year=1817 }} |common_names=Indian plantain |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Conophora |authority=(de Candolle) Nieuwland |rank=genus }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Mesadenia |authority=Rafinesque |rank=genus }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Senecioneae;Arnoglossum |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Senecioneae]]
genus[[Arnoglossum]]
|etymology=Greek arnos, lamb, and glossum, tongue; ancient name for some species of Plantago |volume=Volume 20 |mention_page=page 542 |treatment_page=page 622 }}Perennials, 30–300 cm. Stems usually 1, erect (unbranched proximal to heads). Leaves basal and cauline; alternate; petiolate or sessile; blades palmately nerved, mostly cordate, deltate, elliptic, hastate, ovate, or reniform, sometimes lanceolate or lance-linear, margins entire, ± dentate to denticulate, sinuate, or lobed, faces usually glabrous. Heads discoid, in corymbiform arrays. Calyculi 0. Involucres cylindric to turbinate, 2.5–5 mm diam. Phyllaries persistent, 5 in 1–2 series, erect (spreading in fruit), distinct, ovate or oblong to linear (midveins sometimes winged), ± equal, margins scarious (hyaline). Receptacles flat or convex (usually with central cusp 0.5–2 mm), foveolate, epaleate. Ray florets 0. Disc florets 5, bisexual, fertile; corollas usually creamy or greenish white, rarely purplish distally, tubes longer than to equaling campanulate to funnelform throats, lobes 5, spreading or recurved, lanceolate; style branches: stigmatic areas continuous, apices truncate or truncate-penicillate (appendages essentially 0). Cypselae clavate, cylindric, ellipsoid, or ± fusiform, (4–)10–15-ribbed or -nerved, glabrous (resinous); pappi persistent, fragile, or readily falling, of 100–120+, white, smooth or barbellate bristles. x = 28.{{Treatment/Body |distribution=e North America. |discussion=

Species 8 (8 in the flora).

The name Cacalia Linnaeus has been misapplied to Arnoglossum.

|tables= |references={{Treatment/Reference |id=kral1958a |text=Kral, R. and R. K. Godfrey. 1958. Synopsis of the Florida species of Cacalia. Quart. J. Florida Acad. Sci. 21: 193–206. }}{{Treatment/Reference |id=pippen1978a |text=Pippen, R. W. 1978. Cacalia. In: N. L. Britton et al., eds. 1905+. North American Flora.... 47+ vols. New York. Ser. 2, part 10, pp. 151–159. }}{{Treatment/Reference |id=robinson1974b |text=Robinson, H. 1974b. Studies in the Senecioneae (Asteraceae). VI. The genus Arnoglossum. Phytologia 28: 294–295. }} }}

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnoglossum album |accepted_authority=L. C. Anderson |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Sida |place=18: 378, figs. 1, 6-9. 1998 |year=1998 }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Senecioneae;Arnoglossum;Arnoglossum album |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Senecioneae]]
genus[[Arnoglossum]]
species[[Arnoglossum album]]
|volume=Volume 20 |mention_page= |treatment_page=page 623 }}Plants 80–100+ cm. Stems strongly ridged. Basal leaves: (petioles 12–18+ cm) blades (lateral veins appressed to midveins 2–4 cm, then spreading) broadly ovate to narrowly oblong-lanceolate, 15–37 cm, margins usually entire, rarely sinuate or serrulate-denticulate. Cauline leaves: proximal petiolate, blades ovate (12–18+ cm, bases cuneate), margins serrate (apices acuminate); distal sessile, smaller. Involucres 10–12.5+ mm. Phyllaries (chalky white) ± ovate, midvein wings highest at bases. Corollas white, rarely tinged with pink, 9–10.5 mm. Cypselae cylindric to narrowly clavate, 4.2–5 mm; pappi 6–7 mm. 2n = 50.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering May–mid July. |habitat=Poorly drained, acidic loamy sands, savannas, open pinewoods |elevation=0–10 m |distribution=Fla. |discussion=

Of conservation concern.

Arnoglossum album is known only from Bay and Gulf counties.

|tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnoglossum album |authority=L. C. species[[Arnoglossum atriplicifolium]]
|volume=Volume 20 |mention_page= |treatment_page=page 623 }}Plants 100–300 cm (rhizomatous). Stems smooth to weakly striate (glaucous). Basal leaves: blades usually ovate or ovate-cordate, to 21 cm (bases truncate or subcordate), margins shallowly lobed or dentate (sinuses smooth). Cauline leaves: (abaxial faces pale green, glaucous) proximal petiolate, ± deltate, margins coarsely dentate; distal petiolate or sessile, smaller. Involucres (7.5–)8–10(–10.5) mm. Phyllaries (pale green) oblong, midveins not winged (tips obtuse to acute, sparsely papillate). Corollas white, usually with green, sometimes purple, 8–9.5(–13) mm. Cypselae fusiform or ellipsoid, 4–5 mm (brown or purplish, 8–10-ribbed); pappi 5–6(–7) mm (readily falling). 2n = 50, 52, 56.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Nov. |habitat=Edges of woods, pastures, roadsides |elevation=10–600 m |distribution=Ala.;Ark.;Del.;Fla.;Ga.;Ill.;Ind.;Kans.;Ky.;Md.;Mich.;Minn.;Miss.;Mo.;Nebr.;N.J.;N.Y.;N.C.;Ohio;Okla.;Pa.;S.C.;Tenn.;Va.;W.Va.;Wis. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Arnoglossum atriplicifolium |authority=(Linnaeus) H. Gray) Greene |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Senecio floridanus |authority=Schultz-Bipontinus |rank=species }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Senecioneae;Arnoglossum;Arnoglossum diversifolium |hierarchy_nav=

genus[[Arnoglossum]]
species[[Arnoglossum diversifolium]]
|volume=Volume 20 |mention_page=page 623 |treatment_page=page 624 }}Plants 100–200(–300) cm. Stems proximally ribbed (and purplish), distally angular (and greenish). Basal leaves: (petioles with brownish hairs) blades ovate to cordate-ovate, to 10 cm (bases truncate), margins denticulate. Cauline leaves: proximal petiolate, deltate-hastate, margins dentate (faces glabrous); distal petiolate or sessile, smaller (faces finely puberulent). Involucres (7.5–)9–11 mm. Phyllaries lance-ovate, midvein wings uniform or highest at apices. Corollas white or purplish, 8.5–9.5(–10.5) mm. Cypselae fusiform, 3 mm; pappi (6–)7–8 mm. 2n = 50.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering mid May–early Jul (Aug–Sep, peninsular Florida). |habitat=Wet or mucky soils, along streams, swamps, woodlands |elevation=0–100 m |distribution=Ala.;Fla.;Ga. |discussion=

Of conservation concern.

Arnoglossum diversifolium grows primarily in the Florida panhandle and adjacent Alabama and Georgia, and in Putnam and Levy counties, Florida.

|volume=Volume 20 |mention_page=page 623 |treatment_page=page 624 }}Plants to 100 cm (weakly rhizomatous). Stems 5-ribbed. Basal leaves: blades (usually with 5 main veins from bases) ovate to elliptic, to 18 cm, margins entire. Cauline leaves: proximal petiolate, ovate, margins crenulate; distal petiolate or sessile, smaller. Involucres 12–15 mm. Phyllaries (light green) ovate, midvein wings uniform or highest at apices. Corollas white or light green, (9–)11–12 mm. Cypselae fusiform, 5 mm (green); pappi 7–8.5 mm. 2n = 50, 52.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering May–Jul. |habitat=Dry sand ridges, pine-oak woodlands |elevation=0–20+ m |distribution=Fla. |discussion=

Of conservation concern.

Arnoglossum floridanum is known only from central peninsular Florida.

Harper |rank=variety }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Mesadenia maxima |authority=Schultz-Bipontinus |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Mesadenia ovata |authority= |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Senecio boscianus |authority= |rank=species }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Senecio walteri |authority= |rank=species }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Senecioneae;Arnoglossum;Arnoglossum ovatum |hierarchy_nav=

species[[Arnoglossum ovatum]]
|volume=Volume 20 |mention_page=page 623 |treatment_page=page 624 }}Plants 50–300 cm (weakly rhizomatous). Stems round. Basal leaves: blades ovate to narrowly lanceolate or lance-linear, to 30+ cm, margins usually entire. Cauline leaves: proximal petiolate, ovate to narrowly lanceolate or lance-linear, margins usually entire; distal sessile, smaller. Involucres 8–10 mm. Phyllaries (± purple-tinged) lance-ovate, midveins not winged (tips acute to acuminate, papillate). Corollas usually white or greenish, rarely purplish, 8–9(–10) mm. Cypselae fusiform or clavate, 4–5 mm (dark brown, 7–8-ribbed); pappi (5–)6–7.5 mm. 2n = 50, 52, 56.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering (May–)Aug–Oct(–Dec). |habitat=Wet, sandy woods, lowlands, savannas, roadsides |elevation=0–300 m |distribution=Ala.;Fla.;Ga.;La.;Miss.;N.C.;S.C.;Tex. |discussion=

Arnoglossum ovatum is the most variable species in the genus (as implied by synonymy). Extreme forms (very narrow-leaved, e.g., Cacalia lanceolata form, and broadly ovate-leaved forms) look very distinctive; intergradations occur. Differences could be because of dysploid chromosome races, variances in habitat, or some unknown factors.

Phyllaries (pale green) ovate, midvein wings uniform or highest at apices. Corollas white or greenish, 8–10(–11.5) mm. Basal leaves: (petioles to 30 cm) blades (with 3–5 main veins) reniform or ovate-cordate, to 40+ cm, margins lobed or dentate. Cauline leaves: proximal petiolate, blades ovate, margins entire, serrate, or dentate; distal petiolate or sessile, smaller (rarely hairy). Involucres (8–)10–13(–14) mm. Phyllaries pale green, narrowly ovate, midveins not winged (tips obtuse). Corollas white or greenish, 8–9(–10.5) mm. Cypselae fusiform or clavate, 4–5 mm (dark brown or purple, 4–5-ribbed); pappi 6–8 mm. 2n = 50.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering mid May–early Sep. |habitat=Open woods |elevation=10–500 m |distribution=Ala.;Ark.;Del.;Ga.;Ill.;Ind.;Iowa;Ky.;Md.;Minn.;Miss.;Mo.;N.J.;N.C.;Ohio;Okla.;Pa.;Tenn.;Va.;W.Va.;Wis. |discussion=

Arnoglossum muehlenbergii of H. Robinson, Cacalia muhlenbergii of Fernald, and Mesadenia muhlenbergii of Rydberg were based on Senecio muehlenbergii Schultz-Bipontinus, a superfluous name based on Cacalia reniformis Muhlenberg ex Willdenow.

|volume=Volume 20 |mention_page=page 623 |treatment_page=page 625 }}Plants 70–140 cm. Stems strongly ridged (glabrous or sparsely pubescent). Basal leaves: (petioles 10–45 cm) blades (with 3 main veins from bases) broadly ovate or elliptic, 12–15(–20) cm (bases cuneate, decurrent onto petioles), margins entire, sinuate, crenulate, or denticulate. Cauline leaves: proximal petiolate or sessile (mid stem sessile, bases broadly cuneate), blades narrowly ovate, margins entire, sinuate, crenulate, or denticulate; distal petiolate or sessile, smaller. Involucres (8–)9.5–10(–12) mm. Phyllaries (pale green) ovate, midvein wings uniform or highest at apices. Corollas white or greenish, sometimes tinged with purple, 7–8(–9.5) mm. Cypselae fusiform or clavate, 4 mm (dark brown, 6–8-ribbed); pappi 5–7 mm. 2n = 50.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Sep–Nov. |habitat=Shaded, wet areas of hillside seepages, thickets, and swamps |elevation=0–100 m |distribution=Ala.;Fla.;Ga. |discussion=

Of conservation concern.

Arnoglossum sulcatum occurs in the Florida panhandle and adjacent Georgia and Alabama.

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Arnoseris |accepted_authority=Gaertner |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Fruct. Sem. Pl. |place=2: 355, plate 157, fig. 3. 1791 |year=1791 }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Cichorieae;Arnoseris |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Cichorieae]]
genus[[Arnoseris]]
|etymology=Greek arnos, sheep, and seris, a kind of endive; allusion unclear |volume=Volume 19 |mention_page=page 216 |treatment_page=page 276 }}Annuals, (5–)10–30+ cm; taprooted. Stems 1–10+ (scapiform), erect, simple or branched distally, glabrous. Leaves mostly basal; obscurely petiolate; blades oblanceolate to spatulate, margins dentate (faces usually scabridulous, mostly near margins). Heads borne singly or (2–3) in loose, corymbiform arrays. Peduncles inflated (fistulose) distally, not bracteate. Calyculi 0 or of 1–10+, lanceolate bractlets. Involucres broadly campanulate or urceolate, 4–8 mm diam. Phyllaries 10–22+ in 1(–2) series (basally connate), lanceolate to lance-linear (abaxially keeled proximally), equal or subequal, margins little, if at all, scarious, apices acuminate. Receptacles flat, pitted, glabrous, epaleate. Florets 20–50+; corollas yellow. Cypselae dark brown, obovoid, not beaked, ribs 8–10 (3–5 stronger), stramineous, faces smooth or rugose between ribs, glabrous; pappi 0. x = 9.{{Treatment/Body |distribution=Europe. |introduced=true |discussion=

Species 1.
